com.academiken.framegrabm.util
Class GrabCore

java.lang.Object
  com.academiken.framegrabm.util.GrabCore

public class GrabCore
extends java.lang.Object

GrabCore is the central operations center for initializing, configuring, capturing frames, and shutting down.

Version:
0.8 - 06 March 2012
Author:
Kenneth Perrine

Constructor Detail

GrabCore

public GrabCore()
Method Detail

init

public void init()
          throws com.lti.civil.CaptureException,
                 FrameGrabMException
init is the first activity that must be performed in order to get the video capture working. If init() is called after already initialized, then shutdown() will automatically be called first.

Throws:
com.lti.civil.CaptureException
FrameGrabMException

shutdown

public void shutdown()
              throws com.lti.civil.CaptureException,
                     FrameGrabMException
shutdown terminates all capture activity. It can be the last method called to perform a proper deinitialization.

Throws:
com.lti.civil.CaptureException
FrameGrabMException

getDeviceList

public GrabCoreDevice[] getDeviceList()
                               throws com.lti.civil.CaptureException,
                                      FrameGrabMException
getDeviceList returns an array of GrabCoreDevice objects that each describe one of the capture devices. Use the index value on setDevice() to choose the device to use with frame captures.

Throws:
com.lti.civil.CaptureException
FrameGrabMException

getNumDevices

public int getNumDevices()
                  throws com.lti.civil.CaptureException,
                         FrameGrabMException
getNumDevices returns the number of capture devices that have been detected.

Throws:
com.lti.civil.CaptureException
FrameGrabMException

getFormatList

public GrabCoreFormat[] getFormatList(int deviceIndex)
                               throws FrameGrabMException,
                                      com.lti.civil.CaptureException
getFormatList(int) returns a list of GrabCoreFormat objects that each describe one of the formats supported by the given device.

Parameters:
deviceIndex - The device index to retrieve the formats on.
Throws:
FrameGrabMException
com.lti.civil.CaptureException

getFormat

public int getFormat(int deviceIndex)
              throws FrameGrabMException,
                     com.lti.civil.CaptureException
getFormat(int) returns the current format index for the given device index.

Throws:
FrameGrabMException
com.lti.civil.CaptureException

setFormat

public void setFormat(int deviceIndex,
                      int formatIndex)
               throws FrameGrabMException,
                      com.lti.civil.CaptureException
setFormat sets the desired format on the given device that will be returned when calling grab().

Throws:
FrameGrabMException
com.lti.civil.CaptureException

getState

public boolean getState()
getInitState returns the state of GrabCore. That is, false if this hasn't been initialized, (or shutdown() was called), and true if this is initialized.

getOperState

public boolean getOperState(int deviceIndex)
                     throws FrameGrabMException,
                            com.lti.civil.CaptureException
getOperState returns true if a capture operation is underway for the given device index; e.g. if start() had been called.

Throws:
FrameGrabMException
com.lti.civil.CaptureException

start

public void start(int deviceIndex)
           throws FrameGrabMException,
                  com.lti.civil.CaptureException
start begins the capture process on the given device. Frames will continuously be captured, but will not be available until grab() is called. Start clears out the most recent image that was captured.

Throws:
FrameGrabMException
com.lti.civil.CaptureException

stop

public void stop(int deviceIndex)
          throws FrameGrabMException,
                 com.lti.civil.CaptureException
stop ends the capture process. Whatever frame that had recently been grabbed is available after stopping. The format may be changed and the capture may be restarted.

Throws:
FrameGrabMException
com.lti.civil.CaptureException

isFramePending

public boolean isFramePending(int deviceIndex)
                       throws FrameGrabMException,
                              com.lti.civil.CaptureException
isFramePending returns true if there is a frame or exception waiting for when grab() is called. Otherwise, grab() will block until a frame is ready or a capture exception is thrown.

Throws:
FrameGrabMException
com.lti.civil.CaptureException

grab

public byte[] grab(int deviceIndex)
            throws FrameGrabMException,
                   com.lti.civil.CaptureException
grab returns the most recent captured frame, or throws an exception if there was a capture exception. If a capture process had been started, grab will block until one of these events happens. If a block is interrupted or no capture process is engaged, and nothing is pending, then null is returned. Use isFramePending() to check whether there is a frame pending to prevent unnecessary blocking.

Throws:
FrameGrabMException
com.lti.civil.CaptureException
